title: Crush weapons

properties.name: description
properties.value: Crush is an attack type that is used primarily by weapons like mauls, maces and warhammers, and secondarily by weapons like two-handed swords and battleaxes.

content:
The RuneScape Wiki also has an article on: rsw:Crush weapons

Crush is an attack type that is used primarily by weapons like mauls, maces and warhammers, and secondarily by weapons like two-handed swords and battleaxes.

Contents

  • 1 Weapons
    • 1.1 Main style
      • 1.1.1 Staves
      • 1.1.2 Spiked weapons
      • 1.1.3 Blunt weapons
      • 1.1.4 Unarmed
      • 1.1.5 Polestaves
      • 1.1.6 Bludgeons
      • 1.1.7 Bulwarks
    • 1.2 Secondary style
      • 1.2.1 Pickaxes
      • 1.2.2 Axes
      • 1.2.3 Two-handed swords
      • 1.2.4 Spears
      • 1.2.5 Scythes
      • 1.2.6 Bladed staves
  • 2 Best Crush attack bonus
  • 3 Best Crush defence bonus

Weapons[edit | edit source]

Main style[edit | edit source]

The majority of attack styles associated with the following weapon types are crush-based.

Best Crush attack bonus[edit | edit source]

Slot Item Crush bonus Notes
Inquisitor's great helm[1] +8 Requires 70 and 30 to wear.
Amulet of torture +15 The Amulet of glory gives a +10 bonus, and is significantly cheaper. Requires 75 Hitpoints to wear.
Inquisitor's hauberk[1] +12 Requires 70 and 30 to wear.
Inquisitor's plateskirt[1] +12 Requires 70 and 30 to wear.
Primordial boots +2 Requires 75 and 75 to wear.
Mythical cape +6 Requires completion of the Dragon Slayer II quest.
Avernic defender +28 70 and 70 to equip.
Ferocious gloves +16 Requires 80 and 80 to equip and the completion of Dragon Slayer II.
Tyrannical ring (i) +8 The Tyrannical ring initially gives +4 crush bonus. However, players can imbue their ring via Nightmare Zone or Soul Wars to double the ring's bonuses to +8.
Dragon warhammer +95 Requires 60 to equip.
Inquisitor's mace Requires 75 to equip.
Elder maul +135 Requires 75 and 75 to equip.
TOTAL +214 +202 if using an Inquisitor's mace or Dragon warhammer with an Avernic defender.
  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 The Inquisitor armour set offers 0.5% damage and accuracy to weapons using the Crush style for each piece equipped, with a bonus of 2.5% with the full set equipped

Best Crush defence bonus[edit | edit source]

Slot Item Crush bonus Notes
Justiciar faceguard[1] +59 Requires 75 to be worn.
Amulet of fury +15
Justiciar chestguard[1] +117 Requires 75 to be worn.
Justiciar legguards[1] +93 Requires 75 to be worn.
Guardian boots +32 Requires 75 to wear.
Infernal cape +12 Requires completion of the Inferno.
Elysian spirit shield[2] +75 Requires 75 and 75 to equip.
Barrows gloves +12 Barrows gloves may take a while to get as it requires completion of Recipe for Disaster, along with a minimum of 175 Quest points.
Ring of suffering (i) +20 The Ring of suffering initially gives +10 Defence bonus. However, players can imbue their ring via Nightmare Zone or Soul Wars to double the ring's bonuses to +20. Requires 75 to wear.
Maple blackjack(d) +24 Requires 30 and 30 to equip.
Dinh's bulwark[3] +109 Requires 75 and 75 to equip.
TOTAL +469 +459 if using the Maple blackjack(d) and Elysian spirit shield
  1. ↑ 1.0 1.1 1.2 Wearing the full Justiciar armour set grants an additional passive damage reduction of CrushBonus/3000 against Crush damage (outside of PvP)
  2. ↑ The Elysian spirit shield offers an additional passive damage reduction of 17.5% against Crush damage
  3. ↑ The Dinh's bulwark gains an additional 20% passive damage reduction against Crush damage (outside of PvP)

rawContent:
{{external|rs}}
[[File:Crush style.png|left]]
'''Crush''' is an [[attack type]] that is used primarily by weapons like [[maul]]s, [[mace]]s and [[warhammer]]s, and secondarily by weapons like [[two-handed sword]]s and [[battleaxe]]s.

==Weapons==
===Main style===

The majority of attack styles associated with the following weapon types are crush-based.

====Staves====
{{CombatStyles|Staff}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Staff}}

====Spiked weapons====
{{CombatStyles|Spiked}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Spiked}}

====Blunt weapons====
{{CombatStyles|Blunt}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Blunt}}

====Unarmed====
{{CombatStyles|Unarmed}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Unarmed}}

====Polestaves====
{{CombatStyles|Polestaff}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Polestaff}}

====Bludgeons====
{{CombatStyles|Bludgeon}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Bludgeon}}

====Bulwarks====
{{CombatStyles|Bulwark}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Bulwark}}

===Secondary style===

The following weapon types have at least one crush-based attack.

====Pickaxes====
{{CombatStyles|Pickaxe}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Pickaxe}}

====Axes====
{{CombatStyles|Axe}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Axe}}

====Two-handed swords====
{{CombatStyles|2h Sword}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|2h Sword}}

====Spears====
{{CombatStyles|Spear}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Spear}}

====Scythes====
{{CombatStyles|Scythe}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Scythe}}

====Bladed staves====
{{CombatStyles|Bladed staff}}
{{CombatStylesDisplay|Bladed staff}}
